title: [K-12] Flipped Learning Design and Implementation for Higher Education Science Disciplines

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational scientific theories and experimental methodologies
context.additional_context: Focused on enhancing self-directed learning competencies for adult learners including job seekers in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Using the flipped learning model, learners can pre-learn theoretical content on science topics and participate in discussion and practical activities for over 80% of class time.
Through interaction activities with peers and instructors, learners can improve their science problem-solving skills by at least two levels (based on a 5-point scale).
Learners can create and execute a self-directed learning plan to complete over 70% of a science-related employment competency portfolio within three months.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
